definition: to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet

sentences.english: Cascarellian considered this for a moment. Then he called the convoy to a halt.
sentences.chinese: 老卡斯卡利安想了一會，然後喝令護衛隊停車。

sentences.english: We are the custodians of life’s meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我們纔是生命意義的護衛者。

sentences.english: 27So he immediately sent an executioner with orders to bring John's head. The man went, beheaded John in the prison
sentences.chinese: 隨即差一個護衛兵，吩咐拿約翰的頭來。

sentences.english: Frigates are a vital part of any balanced sea-going fleet.
sentences.chinese: 護衛艦是任何一個配置均衡的遠洋艦隊所必需的。

sentences.english: The program was trimmed to six frigates from the proposed eight.
sentences.chinese: 該計劃把護衛艦數量從8艘削減至6艘。

sentences.english: The whole Babylonian army, under the commander of the imperial guard, broke down the walls around Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 跟從護衛長迦勒底的全軍就拆毀耶路撒冷四圍的城牆。

sentences.english: The commander of the imperial guard took away the censers and sprinkling bowls-all that were made of pure gold or silver.
sentences.chinese: 火鼎，碗，無論金的銀的，護衛長也都帶去了。

sentences.english: Another guard walks behind them, carrying a small stereo playing funeral music.
sentences.chinese: 走在後面的護衛提着一個小立體聲，播放着哀樂。

sentences.english: A Coast Guard officer came on and said, "State your location."
sentences.chinese: 一名海岸護衛隊警官作出了迴應，“報告你的位置”。

sentences.english: They have been republished on the Guardian website.
sentences.chinese: 這些圖片發表在“護衛者”網站上。

sentences.english: This is a new type of frigate with strong power of military attack.
sentences.chinese: 這是艘新型的護衛艦，具有很強的軍事打擊力。

sentences.english: Guards of honor convoy the national flag enter the site of the raising ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 儀仗兵護衛國旗進入升旗儀式現場。

sentences.english: In 1946, at the age of 17, I joined the National Guard.
sentences.chinese: 1946年，我17歲的時候參加了國家護衛隊。

sentences.english: North-South security guards House, responsible for North and the South two security guards of the Privy Council.
sentences.chinese: 北南護衛府，負責北南兩個樞密院的護衛工作。

sentences.english: North-South security guards House, responsible for North and the South two security guards of the Privy Council.
sentences.chinese: 北南護衛府，負責北南兩個樞密院的護衛工作。

sentences.english: Cheng bite gold is carrying big head. it said he will guard the during.
sentences.chinese: 程咬金卻是提着大板斧表示自己要護衛李世民到底。

definition: surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
to start out on a trip/to dispatch troops
to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
to set out (on a campaign)/to stand for election/to throw one's cap in the ring
